theCarbonIs: 今は <utilityMenu></utilityMenu> で発電C02の発生は(たぶん):
carbonGraphTitle: <monthMenu></monthMenu>の <weekdayMenu></weekdayMenu>のカーボンインテンシティ、4年間のアベレージです。

probablySection.title: たぶん？
paragraph: はい、データはライブではないのせいで精度ができません。
このAPIは有史データを電力会社ウェブサイトからダウンロードをしています。このデータ使っているで予報をつくれます。
ライブ電気市場と発電データアクセスがいないのせいで、予報作らなければなりません。
私たちはこのAPI作っているを通じて予報精度に増えているだけど、電力会社からライブデータは一番解決と思います。

howSection.title: カーボンインテンシティをどう割り出しているか？
paragraph: The carbon intensity is calculated for a given period by figuring out the proportion of energy generation that came from each fuel type.

This proportion is then multiplied by the Carbon Intensity for that fuel type, for example, the carbon intensity factor for coal is 937 C02/kWh with Combined Cycle Gas Turbines (CCGT) having a factor of 394 C02/kWh.
This isn't perfect, as each generating plant is likely to have a different carbon intensity factor, which changes over the course of the year.

Even more troublesome, the data used by this tool - which is provided by Japanese utility companies - considers all Fossil Fuels under one heading 'Thermal Generation', so with the data, we cannot tell what kinds of fuel were being burned during that period.
Currently, we use other reporting and sources to try and figure out the average contribution of each fuel source.

We realise this is not perfect and wish that the Japanese utilties would be more transparent about the kinds of fuel they are burning at what times, and what supplementary technologies they are using, such as carbon capture.
howSection.carbonIntensityLink: Currently we draw our Carbon Intensity factors from the UKs own  <carbonLink>Carbon Intensity API</carbonLink>, if equivalent 'Japan specific' research is available we would consider using that instead.
